generation0.title: Introduction to Baseball
generation0.passage: Baseball is a sport played between two teams of nine players each. The objective of the game is to score runs by hitting the ball and running to a series of four bases arranged in a diamond shape. The game is played in innings, with each team having a turn to bat and a turn to field. The team with the most runs at the end of the game wins.

generation1.title: Baseball Positions
generation1.passage: In baseball, players are assigned specific positions on the field. The pitcher stands on the pitcher's mound and throws the ball to the batter. The catcher stands behind the batter to catch any balls that are missed. Other positions include first baseman, second baseman, shortstop, third baseman, and the outfield positions: left field, center field, and right field.

generation2.title: Baseball Strategy
generation2.passage: Baseball is a sport that involves strategy both at the plate and in the field. Teams often use specific batting orders and pitching rotations to maximize their chances of winning. When on defense, teams work together to prevent the opposing team from scoring, using strategies like shifting fielders or calling for a double play.
